results.title: Measuring matter: Volume 1
results.creator_credit: Bill Walker Productions, Bill Walker and Peter Dallas
results.brief_description: This entertaining video which uses an animated investigator Al the Alligator to explain questions of physics. Part one ‘Length’ sees Al investigating the “The Case of the missing running shoe” to solve the mystery of length, using only a metre stick. Part two ‘Mass’ has Al investigating what mass is. He learns to measure Mass and Matter using a tool for this, a balance. He learns that matter has mass and weight, but weight may change depending on the location of the matter. Suitable for Primary level students.

results.title: Measures of distance
results.brief_description: Reading out loud from letters sent by her mother in Beirut, Hatoum constructs a visual montage that evokes feelings of separation and isolation from her Palestinian family. The personal and political are inextricably bound in a narrative that explores personal and family identity against a backdrop of traumatic social rupture, exile and displacement.

results.title: Measurement with light waves
results.creator_credit: Audio Productions and United States. Office of Education
results.brief_description: This film explains the principles of measurement with light waves, the nature of light waves; the reflection and refraction of monochromatic light by a glass surface; the use of these bands in ultra-precision measurement; and their translation into millionths of an inch. The film then goes on to demonstrate the procedures in gauge block inspection, the comparison of gauge blocks for height; the meaning of circular and parallel bands on gauge surfaces; the precautions necessary in measurement with light waves; and the inspection procedures followed.

results.title: Measurement in the metal working industry. No.4. Verniers
results.brief_description: A detailed study of the principles of the vernier scale, and its application to precision measurment, using animation and direct photography. The care of vernier-scaled tools is emphasised; particular care must be taken of such tools if they are to maintain their accuracy.

results.title: Measurement in the metal working industry. No. 2. Micrometer
results.creator_credit: United States. Office of Education and Loucks and Norling Studios
results.brief_description: An explanation of the basic principles on which the micrometer works: correct care, use and maintenance of a micrometer; the various types of micrometers developed to measure outside lengths, inside lengths and depths.

results.title: Measured for transport
results.creator_credit: British Information Services, Edgar H. Anstey and Ronald Craigen
results.brief_description: British transport shows its resourcefulness when a 123-ton transformer has to be carried to a remote site in Wales. Specially devised and strictly scheduled plans are put into operation by road and rail services, and safe delivery from factory to power station is accomplished. Remote rural sections of the route pose special problems but also provide views of Wales’ lovely countryside. Music by Edward Williams. Commentator Richard Baker.

results.title: Measure weight
results.brief_description: Introduces the concept of measuring weight in metric units. Shows two girls as they visit a chemist to learn about the standard units of weight. Tells how they use their new knowledge to compare the weight of common things in their home to make a metric cake.
results.description: Introduces the concept of measuring weight in metric units. Shows two girls as they visit a chemist to learn about the standard units of weight. Tells how they use their new knowledge to compare the weight of common things in their home to make a metric cake.

results.brief_description: Introduces the concept of measuring volume in metric units. Shows young people as they measure the volume of things in their home.

results.title: Measure of man
results.creator_credit: Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films, John Halas and Tony Guy
results.brief_description: A brief animated history of measurement which shows that measuring is arbitrary and that counting is not. The most important advantage of the metric system of measurement is the interrelationship of the units. Common metric units are whosn within their range of application.

results.title: Measure metric: length 3: the final test
results.brief_description: Demonstrates how to estimate the lengths of various objects. Demonstrates estimation, measurement, recording, selecting an appropriate instrument, and using equivalents and decimal notation. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.
